document_data.name: Dispel Shunt
document_data.mainbody: '''''Dispel shunt''''' was a [[spell]] that protected its caster from ''[[dispel magic]]''.
document_data.Effects:
The spell remained in effect for ten minutes, redirecting any ''[[dispel magic]]'' spell cast upon the caster to another location of their choice about {{SI|120|feet|long=yes}} or maybe about twice that. However, it would be reflected by any spell barrier at least as complex as a ''[[wall of ice]]''. There was a risk, if the dispelling attempt was focused on its original caster, that the shunt would be broken instead, though it still protected the caster.

The ''shunt'' had unique interactions with ''[[antimagic field]]'', being able to break that spell, but at the same time, it would be broken rather than suppressed; it had a similar response to ''[[Mordenkainen's disjunction]]'', though its chances were somewhat slimmer. It also protected the target somewhat against a ''[[rod of cancellation]]'', improving their odds of enduring the effect somewhat; finally, it could block the ray of a ''[[wand of negation]]'', disabling it for a couple minutes due to feedback, though this consumed the shunt.
document_data.Components: The spell only required [[verbal]] and [[somatic]] components.
document_data.History: [[Azuth]] made this spell available through [[Elminster]] sometime prior to {{yearlink|1370}}.{{cite book/Secrets of the Magister|101}}
